timeline.author: VaishSiddharth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,5 +26,7 @@

+	        ReferenceParam hasMemberReference, TokenAndListParam valueConcept, DateRangeParam valueDateParam,

replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: I'd actually prefer it if SP_CODE came after the SP_SUBJECT and before all these other search functions.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: will make this change in the next commit
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Please have a look
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: I actually don't think that you need to turn the has-member.code parameter into a codeable concept. Just refactor out the relevant part of the handleCodedConcept method from FhirObservationDaoImpl into BaseDaoImpl and call that.
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Isn't it better to have only one parameter as hasMember and through that we could search by hasMember.code as well. Will the above code not be a good option to use?
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText:
So the property you should use is groupMembers. And, you're right that we'll need two branches here, but the handling for SP_CODE will need to be a bit more complex to handle:
/ws/fhir2/Observation?has-member.code=http://loinc.org|8854-6
😄
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @VaishSiddharth Do you see what I'm getting at here?
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's the idea!
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher Please help me resolve this issue
timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: Change VALUE_QUANTITY from "134.0" to 134.0d and change the type to double.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Still the same error
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

@Test
	public void searchForObs_shouldSearchForObsByValueQuantity() {
		QuantityAndListParam quantityAndListParam = new QuantityAndListParam();
		
		QuantityOrListParam quantityOrListParam = new QuantityOrListParam();
		
		QuantityParam quantityParam = new QuantityParam();
		quantityParam.setValue(134.0d);
		quantityAndListParam.addAnd(quantityOrListParam.add(quantityParam));
		
		// Error java.lang.ClassCastException: class java.lang.String cannot be cast to class java.lang.Double (java.lang.String and java.lang.Double are in module java.base of loader 'bootstrap')
		Collection<Obs> results = dao.searchForObservations(null, null, null, null, null, quantityAndListParam, null, null,
		    null, null);
		
		assertThat(results, notNullValue());
		assertThat(results, not(empty()));
		assertThat(results, hasItem(hasProperty("uuid", equalTo(OBS_UUID))));
	}

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Found the solution for this. Thanks for the help
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

timeline.bodyText: We shouldn't use ilike here, which is only for matching strings. We should use eq.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Ok I will change this. Is everything else fine, should I complete the code & tests and update the PR?
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: I haven't really gone through everything else here, but please do keep this up to date
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher Please help me with this error
timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: So MEMBER_UUID should be referring to the UUID that is the member of an obs group. An Obs is a member of an obs group when the obs_group_id column points to the id of another observation.
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: When you say "pointing to both ids", could you spell out what you mean?
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: The first one looks right to me. Could you make those changes to this branch and push it out? That way we can both be looking at the same code.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher Any ideas what's wrong here?
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher Not very sure how to handle 1e2 type of numbers please have a look
timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: My advice would be to write a test case using "1e2" and see what happens.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Should be and rather than or
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Of course, better than using and or or here would be to use between
replies.author: ibacher
VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: So, for our purposes, I'm less concerned that we map "1e2" to [95 ... 105) than I am that we map 1e-2 to [.005 ... .015), i.e., even if we're not matching the precision implied by the spec, I think we're ok. Properly support 1e2 would, I think, require us to go a little crazy writing a string to number parser.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher I need a way to test these ranges then only I'll be able to code something up for 1e-2 like numbers. Please suggest a way to do so
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: So, the quickest way to test is to search (at the DAO level) for an Obs with a quantity of "36". There's exactly one Obs in the dataset that should fall in that range (Obs 7e77d071-1f7d-4394-a316-0a458edf28c3; it represents body temperature). Then I'd do a search a search for 39.5. That should have a single result, (Obs 1a9b5242-0ff9-4c5c-adb3-d517632ea63e). That should show that it finds values within ±10%.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Should be and rather than or
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Of course, better than using and or or here would be to use between
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be le?
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
@ibacher So here I saw something like
[99.995 ... 100.005)
where ) means not included that's why I used lt and not le
Please let me know what's correct
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: Good point
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Should be and
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Of course, better than using and or or here would be to use between
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher So I have added some tests which don't pass at the moment because the prefix coding is not correct for 1e2 and 1e-2 type of numbers.
timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: So, for prefix coding, I'm happy with eq being an exact equality, e.g. 1e2 means only exactly 100 (despite the spec, this is the actual implementation in the HAPI JPA Server). ap should still work, since 1e2 should still translate to [90 ... 100]. le, ge, lt, and gt are all defined as starting from the exact position at infinite precision, so again should be covered by just the normal Hibernate operations.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher I have pushed a commit after this please have a look and tell if anything needs to be fixed
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

timeline.bodyText: @ibacher We'll need to correct this part
timeline.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This has the wrong UUID, since we elected not to implement the approximation range without a decimal point, the search range for 1e2 is [99.5 ... 100.5], which is fine, but only UUID 89fg071-1f7d-4394-a316-0a458edf28c3 falls into that range. The other test works for me.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
But here I couldn't find the same range



[parameter]=1e2
Values that equal 100, to 1 significant figures precision, so this is actually searching for values in the range [95 ... 105)



Does 1e-2 works for you?
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: I'm aware. This is a point where I'm suggesting we break spec, because the alternative seems to be to write a parser for scientific notation. Maybe we'll reassess later, but I don't think that's necessary at this point in time. And, yes, 1e-2 worked for me without modifications...
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Can we refactor out the lambda in here (the expression beginning (system, tokens) ->) and turn it into a proper method which can be called both here and handleResourceCode
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Also refactor handleResourceCode to be called handleCodeableConcept. Hopefully we can eventually get rid of the TokenOrListParam version of that.
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher So I guess we'll need to change the parameter either here or in handleResourceCode to make it TokenOrListParam or TokenAndListParam
replies.author: VaishSiddharth

replies.bodyText: Well, I'd like to keep them separate for now so that anything that's relying on TokenOrListParam doesn't break and we keep the scope of this PR relatively focused. We can have two method with the same name that are distinguished by parameter types, so that shouldn't be an issue. We just need to make these two resemble each other so it's clear that they provide the same functionality.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: I'd rename this handleQuantity() and move it to BaseDaoImpl. I'd also rename the parameter quantityAndListParam.

replies.author: VaishSiddharth

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need a separate method for this any more. Just inline this for handleCodeableConcept. However, this function should still take the conceptMapAlias and conceptReferenceTermAlias parameters instead of hard-coding them as cm and crt.
